chapter.para: Before you begin the installation, please make sure your system meets all the requirements listed below.

sect1.title: Cluster Size Requirements
sect1.para: &productname; only functions in a clustered configuration. It requires a group of at least four physical or virtual machines. This will yield a cluster with one &admin_node;, one &master_node;, and two &worker_node;s.
All clusters must contain a single &admin_node; and at least one &master_node; and one &worker_node;.
For improved performance and reliability, an odd number of &master_node;s and any number of &worker_node;s up may be added.

note.title: Test and Proof-of-Concept Clusters
note.para: It is possible to provision a three-node cluster with only a single &worker_node;, but this is not a supported configuration for deployment.

listitem.para: Each node must have an AMD64/Intel* EM64T processor; quad-core processors are recommended. 32-bit processors are not supported.
40 GB available disk space (or more depending on the count and size of the container images you intend to run).
In order to communicate without interruptions, all nodes should to be on the same network.
A DHCP server to dynamically provide IP addresses and host names for the nodes in your cluster (unless you configure all nodes statically).
A DNS server to resolve host names. Please make sure you have reliable DNS resolution at all times, especially in combination with DHCP.

important.title: Unique Host Names
important.para: All nodes' host names must be unique. It is recommended to let the DHCP server provide not only the IP addresses but also the host names of the cluster nodes. If two or more nodes have the same hostname, bootstrap of the cluster will fail.

listitem.para: The &admin_node; must have a valid fully-qualified domain name (FQDN), which must be visible and accessible from a separate machine with a web browser in order to complete the installation.

The FQDN is required during installation and cannot subsequently be added or changed. For test purposes, the IP address of the &admin_node; can be substituted for a FQDN, but this is not supported for production deployment.
&productname; &productnumber; supports up to 50 nodes per cluster.
&productname; &productnumber; does not support remote installations with Virtual Network Computing (VNC)..
&productname; is a dedicated cluster-node operating system. Dual-booting with other operating systems is not supported. It must be the only operating system installed on each node.
